definition: to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
mountain/hill/anything that resembles a mountain/CL:座[zuo4]/bundled straw in which silkworms spin cocoons/gable
collisional orogeny/mountain building as a result of continents colliding

sentences.english: So-called world a stone, is the best orogenic material.
sentences.chinese: 號稱天下第一石，是造山的絕佳材料。

sentences.english: They occurred under the tectonic setting ranging from post collision uplift to late orogenesis.
sentences.chinese: 產生於板塊碰撞後隆起到造山晚期的構造背景。

sentences.english: The mineralization time of the deposits in both of the area is coupled with the orogenic phase.
sentences.chinese: 礦牀的形成時間都與造山作用的時間相一致。

sentences.english: It was recognized that different orogenic cycles were accompanied by corresponding granitic rocks.
sentences.chinese: 不同的造山旋迴伴有相應的花崗岩。

sentences.english: The Bogda mountain chain is an ideal area for the study of intracontinental orogeny and revival orogeny.
sentences.chinese: 是開展陸內造山和再生造山研究的理想之地。

sentences.english: The Bogda mountain chain is an ideal area for the study of intracontinental orogeny and revival orogeny.
sentences.chinese: 是開展陸內造山和再生造山研究的理想之地。

sentences.english: The collision orogeny is a uniformitive process after the collision event.
sentences.chinese: 碰撞造山作用是一個在碰撞事件之後的均變過程。

sentences.english: Two fundamentally different orogenic systems have existed on Earth throughout the Phanerozoic.
sentences.chinese: 地球上有兩套完全不同的造山系統一直存在於顯生宙。

sentences.english: Lanshantou gneiss suit formed under the crust extensional environment at post collision setting.
sentences.chinese: 碰撞造山後期地殼伸展，形成嵐山頭片麻岩套。

sentences.english: In the Late Devonian, the orogenic process was strong in the western part of the orogenic belt and formed n disintegration area.
sentences.chinese: 晚泥盆世造山帶西段造山作用劇烈，形成剝蝕區。

sentences.english: The end of the sedimentation of the foreland basin indicates completion of the collisional orogeny.
sentences.chinese: 前陸盆地的終結標誌着碰撞造山作用的結束。

definition: fourth period/quaternary (geological period covering the recent ice ages over the last 180,000 years)
pre-Cambrian, geological period before c. 540m years ago
